meanings.sent1: The presold tickets ensured a full house for the concert.
meanings.sent2: The presold items were already spoken for before the sale began.
meanings.sent3: The presold seats made the event feel exclusive and special.
meanings.sent4: Her presold artwork was in high demand among collectors.
meanings.sent5: The presold vacation packages saved us money and guaranteed our spot.

meanings.sent1: They presold all the tickets for the event weeks before the date.
meanings.sent2: The company presold their new product to loyal customers.
meanings.sent3: He presold his car to his friend before even putting up a 'for sale' sign.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent presold the house by showing it to interested buyers before listing it.
meanings.sent5: The bakery presold a batch of special cakes for a customer's upcoming celebration.
